alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 12 at 2:32PM MDT until April 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEAST NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM THURSDAY FOR MUCH OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO AS WELL AS THE SOUTHWEST MOUNTAINS AND MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Southwest winds are on the uptrend today, but will increase further on Thursday. Strengthening winds will combine with low humidity, above normal temperatures and an unstable atmosphere to produce critical fire weather conditions over northeast New Mexico through this evening and over a wider area Thursday afternoon and evening. Critical fire weather conditions may return on Friday across east central New Mexico as well. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Thursday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124), Central Highlands (Zone 125), and West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from midday Thursday through Thursday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from near 7 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; West Central Basin and Range
